instrupy.passive_optical_scanner_model.PassiveOpticalScannerModel¶

class instrupy.passive_optical_scanner_model.PassiveOpticalScannerModel(name=None, mass=None, volume=None, power=None, orientation=None, fieldOfViewGeometry=None, sceneFieldOfViewGeometry=None, maneuver=None, pointingOption=None, dataRate=None, scanTechnique=None, numberDetectorRows=None, numberDetectorCols=None, apertureDia=None, Fnum=None, focalLength=None, operatingWavelength=None, bandwidth=None, quantumEff=None, opticsSysEff=None, numOfReadOutE=None, targetBlackBodyTemp=None, bitsPerPixel=None, detectorWidth=None, maxDetectorExposureTime=None, atmosLossModel=None, _id=None)[source]¶

A passive optical scanner class. Supports following types of passive optical scanners:

  • Rectangular aperture imager with square detector elements.

  • WHISKBROOM, PUSHBROOM and MATRIX_IMAGER scanning techniques.

Variables

  • name (str) – Full name of the instrument.

  • mass (float) – Total mass (kg) of this entity.

  • volume (float) – Total volume (m3) of this entity.

  • power (float) – Nominal operating power (W).

  • orientation (instrupy.util.Orientation) – Orientation of the instrument.

  • fieldOfView (instrupy.util.ViewGeometry) – Field of view of instrument specification (SphericalGeometry and Orientation).

  • sceneFieldOfView – Scene field of view specification (SphericalGeometry and Orientation).

  • maneuver (instrupy.util.Maneuver) – Maneuver specification of the instrument.

  • fieldOfRegard (list, instrupy.util.ViewGeometry) – Field of regard of the instrument taking into account the sceneFOV and manueverability of the satellite-sensor system. Note that this shall be a list in order to accommodate non-intersecting view-geometries. TODO: Modify behavior to have FOR = FOV when no maneuver is specified (hence fixed pointing).

  • pointingOption (list, orbitpy.util.Orientation) – List of Orientation objects which specify the orientationsinto which the instrument-axis can be maneuvered. The orientation must be specified in the NADIR_POINTING frame.

  • dataRate (float) – Rate of data recorded (Mbps) during nominal operations.

  • scanTechnique (instrupy.passive_optical_scanner_model.ScanTech) – Scan technique.

  • numberDetectorRows (int) – Number of detector rows (along the Y-axis of the SENOR_BODY_FIXED frame). If the SENSOR_BODY_FIXED frame is aligned to the NADIR_POINTING frame, this direction corresponds to the along-track direction.

  • numberDetectorCols (int) – Number of detector columns (along the X-axis of the SENOR_BODY_FIXED frame). If the SENSOR_BODY_FIXED frame is aligned to the NADIR_POINTING frame, this direction corresponds to the cross-track direction.

  • Fnum (float) – F-number/ F# of lens.

  • focalLength (float) – Focal length of lens in meters.

  • operatingWavelength (float) – Center operating wavelength in meters.

  • bandwidth (float) –

    Bandwidth of operation in meters.

    Note

    It is assumed that the detector element supports the entire bandwidth with same quantum efficiency for all wavelengths. Assumption maybe reasonable for narrow-bandwidths.

  • quantumEff (float) – Quantum efficiency of the detector element (\(0 < qe < 1\))

  • opticsSysEff (float) – Optical systems efficiency (\(0 < \tau_0 < 1\))

  • numOfReadOutE (float) – Number of read out electrons of the detector.

  • targetBlackBodyTemp (float) – Target body’s equivalent black-body temperature in Kelvin.

  • bitsPerPixel (int) – Bits encoded per pixel of image.

  • detectorWidth (float) – Width of detector element in meters.

  • apertureDia (float) – Telescope aperture diameter in meters.

  • maxDetectorExposureTime (float) – Maximum exposure time of detector in seconds.

  • atmosLossModel (instrupy.passive_optical_scanner_model.AtmosphericLossModel or None) – The atmospheric loss model. ‘LOWTRAN7’ model is supported. If None the atmospheric losses are not be considered.

  • _id (str or int) – Unique instrument identifier.
